alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 12:21PM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Illinois...Iowa... Mississippi River at Burlington affecting Hancock, Henderson, Lee and Des Moines Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is expected in the next 24-48 hours. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Burlington. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Water affects low lying buildings and homes in Montrose and Niota. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 14.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening and continue rising to 16.4 feet Monday morning. The river is expected to continue rising until at least early May. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
